comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: William T. File was a New York City police officer. In this photo he is most likely giving testimony in one of the the murder trails (1912 and 1914) of Charles Becker, the first American police officer ever executed for murder. File is mentioned in a couple of paragraphs in this long New York Times article from July, 1912, and in a few other Times articles of the time. He is listed as the second witness for the prosecution in the 1914 retrial in this May 4, 1914, Times article.

comment.author: 37390974@N05
comment._content: The focus on  the side profile of the witness's face in contrast to the blurred background gives importance to the subject. The police officer's body language also speaks volumes, from his hand clutched around his hat to his slumpy posture.

comment._content:
I get the feeling he is William James File (1875-?) according to the World War I draft.
